newsitem.title: ITALY: SPECIALISTS BID FOR 149 BLN LIRE ITALY 18-MO CTZ.
newsitem.headline: SPECIALISTS BID FOR 149 BLN LIRE ITALY 18-MO CTZ.

text.p: Specialist bond traders bid for 149 billion lire of 18-month zero coupon certificates (CTZ) against the Italian Treasury's offer of 150 billion lire of paper.
Earlier, the Treasury received bids for 2.48 trillion lire at the open auction for the December 30, 1998 paper, against 1.50 trillion lire worth of certificates on offer.
The auction price was set at 92.00 from 92.00 at the previous CTZ sale on July 28.
